page.title: 02Arts and Crafts
page.content: There are no special craft centres in this area but a number of women in the district belong to their nearest Womens' Institute where they learn many arts and crafts such as dying, weaving lambs and sheep wool which they knit into all sorts of garments. They crochet, make pottery, do silver and pewter work, sewing and embroidery. Chestnut trees are grown and cut down about every fifteen years to make spile fencing. A few people paint and draw for pleasure, some in their own homes and others in groups or singly in the countryside.
